page.title: 04Ecology, Escrick area.
page.content: The soil in our area ranges from being peaty and bog-like in poorly drained parts to boulder clay on the Escrick moraine which stretches from Cawood to Wheldrake.Most of the land cover is arable farmland,and has been drained.During World War 2 the land which had been grassland was intensively farmed,with drainage subsidies providing an incentive to drain and cultivate the land.A beck which flows through Escrick has been deepened and widened,and a flood barrier built at Stillingfleet has helped,but not stopped,flooding in the area.The water in the beck is constantly tested for chemical build-up.The local farmers are conscious of the need to conserve woodland and hedges which act as wind breaks,and which also give shelter to many species of wildlife.
